p:
After quality control, on average, 92.8%,Â 89.9%, and 93.0% of unique reads from the cerebrum, liver, and muscle tissues, respectively, were mapped to the reference genome. A summary of sequencing throughput and mapping rates per sample and tissue is reported in Tables S1, S2, and S3. Mapped reads saturation plot showed that, on average, 92% of the genes were identified, supporting an adequate read-depth per tissue in the current study (Figure S1). The multi-tissue normalization approach ( see
Methods ) identified 17,164 genes out of 27,607 reported on the Ensembl annotation file that were clustered by tissue, as shown in Figure S2.
